definition: to get away/to escape (from obligations)/to free oneself/to disengage
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: Village work to get to meet with siew, he put away the resolution dove.
sentences.chinese: 中村功得以脫身去與蕭船見面，他決議除掉白鴿。

sentences.english: Finally, she wiggled out from under a heavy blanket and out of the machine.
sentences.chinese: 最後，她從一張厚重毛毯與機器中擺動脫身。

sentences.english: Fast-money traders are selling as they are stopped out of short-term positions.
sentences.chinese: 投機者在拋售，是因爲他們正從短期頭寸脫身。

sentences.english: How can a server get away without formally defining a contract?
sentences.chinese: 不正式地定義契約，服務器怎麼可能得以脫身？

sentences.english: Schiller, Goethe only in the face, only feel the need to escape out.
sentences.chinese: 席勒，也只有在歌德面前，才覺得有必要脫身而出。

sentences.english: You just can't get away without mastering specific business skills.
sentences.chinese: 你在沒有掌握具體的業務技能時是無法脫身的。

sentences.english: In other time it is no apology at all if Japan can get away.
sentences.chinese: 而在其他時間，如果日本能脫身，道歉連門都沒有。

sentences.english: When the dog shakes, centripetal forces pull the water away.
sentences.chinese: 狗一抖動，向心力就使水脫身而出。

sentences.english: The rules portray 18th century combat in a detailed manner without bogging down the player.
sentences.chinese: 規則塑造18世紀的作戰中詳細地脫身下來播放。

sentences.english: He fumbles for a way out.
Zhu himself gets tangled in a love dilemma.
sentences.chinese: 朱孝廉自己也陷入了愛情的困境，難以脫身。

sentences.english: And Chrysler is on the verge of exiting from its bankruptcy in record time.
sentences.chinese: 還有，克萊斯勒快要從破產中快速的脫身而出了。

sentences.english: And never get out to let the rugh in surrey waited her a card at night.
sentences.chinese: 而無法脫身的盧伊薩只好讓卡白白等了她一個晚上。

sentences.english: Take your attention into present, and immediately the past no longer has that power over you.
sentences.chinese: 將你的注意力聚焦於現在，倏然你即從過去脫身開去。

sentences.english: I first took up walking as a means of escape.
sentences.chinese: 我最初開始散步是作爲一種脫身之計。

sentences.english: He had no chance to get away.

definition: the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
lit. to rein in the horse at the edge of the precipice (idiom)/fig. to act in the nick of time
to save or redeem (a situation)/to mediate/to intercede
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
to cross the sea by a trick (idiom)/to achieve one's aim by underhanded means
to escape (danger)/to rescue/to come out alive
to sound out the difficulties and retreat to avoid defeat (idiom); fig. to back out of an awkward situation/to get out on finding out what it's really like
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to turn a blind eye to
to take a risk out of desperation (idiom)
to advance gradually and entrench oneself at every step/to consolidate at every step
